StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Genetic Epidemiology Network of Salt-Sensitivity (GenSalt)

Person.Organization: UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS AT CHICAGOUNIVERSITY OF CHICAGO

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The TOPMed acknowledgement statement can be found at: https://topmed.nhlbi.nih.gov/acknowledgements. In addition please include: "This work was supported by a cooperative agreement project grant (U01HL072507, R01HL087263, and R01HL090682) from the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD. Research reported in this publication was supported by the National Institute of General Medical Sciences of the National Institutes of Health under Award Number P20GM109036. The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health. A detailed description of the GenSalt study has been published previously (GenSalt Collaborative Research Group GenSalt: rationale, design, methods and baseline characteristics of study participants. Journal of Human Hypertension 2007; 21(8): 639-646)."
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data must be related to High blood pressure and related cardiovascular-renal disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Please note that only full or expedited IRB approvals will be accepted.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Controlled-access (GSR are sensitive according to the Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (High blood pressure and related cardiovascular-renal disease, IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-HCR-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to High blood pressure and related cardiovascular-renal disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.
Please note that only full or expedited IRB approvals will be accepted.

ConsentGroup.title: Exchange Area (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: EA-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use by NHLBI TOPMed study investigators only. There is one consent group: DS-HCR-IRB. Use of the data must be related to High blood pressure and related cardiovascular-renal disease. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (only full or expedited IRB approvals will be accepted).

StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NHLBI TOPMed: Genetic Epidemiology Network of Salt-Sensitivity (GenSalt)

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The TOPMed acknowledgement statement can be found at: https://www.nhlbiwgs.org/acknowledgements. In addition please include: "This work was supported by a cooperative agreement project grant (U01HL072507, R01HL087263, and R01HL090682) from the National Heart, Lung and Blood Institute, National Institutes of Health, Bethesda, MD. Research reported in this publication was supported by the National Institute of General Medical Sciences of the National Institutes of Health under Award Number P20GM109036. The content is solely the responsibility of the authors and does not necessarily represent the official views of the National Institutes of Health. A detailed description of the GenSalt study has been published previously (GenSalt Collaborative Research Group GenSalt: rationale, design, methods and baseline characteristics of study participants. Journal of Human Hypertension 2007; 21(8): 639-646)."
Policy.ic_specific_access_term: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (only full or expedited IRB approvals will be accepted).

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval.

ConsentGroup.title: Exchange Area (IRB)
ConsentGroup.name: EA-IRB
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use by NHLBI TOPMed study investigators only. There is one consent group: GRU-IRB. Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval (only full or expedited IRB approvals will be accepted).
